archetype_name: Family Turkish & North African Suppers (Medium, 30–60, Intermediate)
name: Turkish-Style Beef & Green Bean Güveç with Cumin-Turmeric Rice and Lemon-Parsley Chopped Salad
description: Oven-finished beef and green bean tomato stew with warm spices, served with fragrant cumin-turmeric basmati rice and a bright lemon-parsley salad. Medium warmth and family-friendly sides.
prep_steps: Rinse basmati rice until water runs clear; drain.
Trim green beans; cut into 4–5 cm pieces.
Dice onions and red onion separately; chop tomatoes (if using whole) or have crushed tomatoes ready.
Chop cucumber and tomatoes for salad; roughly chop parsley.
Cut beef into 2–3 cm cubes; pat dry.
Halve lemon and set aside for juicing.
cook_steps: StoveTop: Heat olive oil in a deep oven-safe pan over medium-high. Season beef with salt and black pepper; sear in batches until browned (5–7 min).
StoveTop: Add onions and a pinch of salt; cook until translucent (3–4 min). Stir in garlic, cumin, paprika, cinnamon, chili flakes, and bay leaves; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
StoveTop: Add crushed tomatoes and a splash of water if needed to loosen. Stir in green beans; bring to a simmer and adjust salt and black pepper.
Oven: Cover the pan (or transfer to a covered baking dish) and bake 25–30 minutes until beef is tender and beans are soft but not mushy.
StoveTop (Rice): In a saucepan, warm olive oil over medium heat. Add cumin seeds; sizzle 20–30 seconds. Stir in rinsed basmati rice, turmeric powder, and salt; toast 30 seconds.
StoveTop (Rice): Add water (about 1.5–1.75 cups per cup of rice). Bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and cook 12 minutes. Rest off heat 5 minutes, then fluff.
Salad: In a bowl, combine cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, and parsley. Add olive oil, lemon juice, sumac, and a pinch of salt; toss.
Finish: Remove bay leaves from the stew. Taste and adjust seasoning or chili flakes for medium heat. Serve stew over or alongside the rice with salad on the side.
